meanings.definition: To connect or link together in a chain or series.
meanings.sent1: The children catenated their colorful building blocks to create a long chain.
meanings.sent2: The train cars were catenated to form a long line stretching across the tracks.
meanings.sent3: The monkeys catenated their tails together for a game of follow the leader.
meanings.sent4: The dancers catenated their movements seamlessly, creating a mesmerizing performance.
meanings.sent5: The beads were catenated into a beautiful necklace, each one linked to the next.

meanings.definition: Linked together in a chain or series.
meanings.sent1: The catenated paper clips formed a long chain on the desk.
meanings.sent2: The catenated lights illuminated the pathway in a beautiful sequence.
meanings.sent3: The catenated train cars looked like a colorful caterpillar moving along the tracks.
meanings.sent4: The catenated voices of the choir blended harmoniously in the concert hall.
meanings.sent5: The catenated flags fluttered in the wind, creating a mesmerizing display of unity.
